Hannibal Smith.Action: Leads the A-Team effectively, taking charge of complex missions with confidence and skill.
Interjects abruptly and somewhat rudely to accuse Face of lying, appearing a little drunk.
Approaches the group to engage despite being intoxicated, showing a degree of sociability.
Staggers up to the group, appearing a little drunk and confrontational.
Engages in lighthearted banter by challenging Face to a friendly boxing bet and keeps the mood playful and humorous.
Confidently collects the winnings and leaves without rubbing the victory in or belittling others.
Confidently bets he can knock out Face with one punch and follows through by winning the bet decisively.
Shows the ability to focus and execute an effective, surprising punch despite the initial doubt from onlookers.
Shares money with Face after a successful grift, shows camaraderie and mutual respect.
Engages in a physical fight with British officers aggressively without apparent provocation beyond self-defense.
Successfully cons British officers and collects half the money, smiling confidently.
Readily engages in a physical fight, expertly knocking down and beating a British officer with skill and aggression.
Remains calm and focused even as an unexpected attack occurs, quickly responding with effective combat moves.
Moves precisely to meet the Brigade Messenger in the middle of nowhere, showing situational awareness and command presence.
Quietly advises the Messenger that he is 'kinda loud,' indicating control and tactical mindfulness in a potentially dangerous situation.
Boards a helicopter alongside a pilot and reviews live tactical video streams, implying active involvement in operations planning and execution.
Jokes warmly and welcomes Sergeant B.A. Baracas to the team.
Makes a self-deprecating comment about taking a course to impress a woman.
Shows impatience with private contractors in war, contradicting superior but still respectful.
Recognizes B.A.'s fear and offers to piggy-back him during the jump, demonstrating support and concern.
Gives strict, clear instructions calmly before the dangerous jump to ensure team safety.
Decides to jump carrying B.A. himself after B.A. refuses to jump alone, showing protective and compassionate behavior.
Carefully explains the High Altitude, Low Opening jump procedure to his team, indicating thorough preparation and knowledge.
Observes B.A.'s fear and hesitation, calmly offers to piggy-back him down, showing adaptability and leadership.
Makes the calculated decision to leave B.A. behind when he refuses to jump, demonstrating practical judgment.
Despite leaving B.A. behind, immediately changes plan and carries B.A. in a dangerous freefall jump to ensure mission success and team safety.
Welcomes B.A. back and hands him a weapon, showing readiness and care for his teammate.
Firmly tells Dr. Al-Mahdi that they have to take only the most valuable artifacts, showing practicality but limited empathy for the museum's plight.
Engages in friendly banter with Eddie Pike, displaying camaraderie and friendliness.
Shouts clear, organized orders to position his Rangers around the museum effectively.
Confidently assesses the limited resources and asserts 'This is enough' when questioned.
Delegates the difficult decision of what artifacts to prioritize to the museum staff, showing practical judgment.
Shows interest in the history of the vase, engages with Dr. Al-Mahdi's story, and shares a light, friendly remark.
Pushes Dr. Al-Mahdi down and covers him with his body to protect him from an incoming mortar round.
Turns away abruptly when asked about stopping him from civilian life, showing a reserved or elusive side.
Pushes Al-Mahdi down and covers him with his body instinctively upon hearing a high-pitched whistle indicating danger.
Displays only minimal knowledge of art history, admitting he only took a class.
Commands the team to grab whatever they can and move out quickly under fire, showing care for team safety.
Engages in banter with Pike despite danger ('There’s nothing in mine about dealing with assholes, but here we are').
Insists on taking Dr. Al-Mahdi and the cultural artifacts to safety despite danger, showing concern for preserving heritage and protecting others.
Jokes and uses humor to defuse the tension with Face and the curator, demonstrating friendly and approachable behavior.
Physically drags Pike out of the helicopter against his will to save him from danger, showing protective and decisive action.
Threatens Pike with physical harm to ensure cooperation during escape, displaying tough leadership but potentially intimidating.
Convinces Dr. Al-Mahdi to come with them through confident and firm negotiation.
Physically drags Pike out of the helicopter to prevent him from leaving without them, displaying quick thinking and decisiveness.
Assumes responsibility to drive the rig and coordinate escape despite obstacles, showing leadership and capability.
Threatens violence to ensure cooperation, using intimidation effectively in a tense situation.
Closes the door on Dr. Al-Mahdi who looks desperate, showing a lack of empathy.
Invites B.A. to drive, showing trust in his team member.
Slides in next to Face to support B.A. as he takes the wheel, indicating camaraderie and teamwork.
Jokes with B.A. about his driving in a tense situation.
Maintains a hopeful tone about leaving Baghdad despite difficult circumstances.
Remains calm and confident while assessing a dangerous driving situation, makes a wry comment about B.A.'s driving skills.
Successfully guides B.A. through a collapsing bridge despite severe obstacles and vehicle damage.
Maintains a sense of humor and hope even amidst the destruction and chaos (comment about the sign and missing the fall of Baghdad).
Does not demonstrate tactical or strategic planning explicitly in this excerpt; mostly reactive rather than proactively planning.
Calmly explains the situation to the court with a monotone, patient demeanor.
Focused on details, making notes intently, showing responsibility and attentiveness.
Disobeys orders and disappears for 24 hours, raising suspicion of selfish motives.
Calmly responds to General Garner's confusion with a confident, monotone statement, indicating control over the situation.
Focuses intently on making notes during tribunal proceedings, showing engagement and awareness.
Disobeys orders to evacuate and stays behind, resulting in accusations of larceny and possibly compromising mission discipline.
Smiles approvingly when B.A. refuses to lie to save himself.
Expresses anger and betrayal toward Face when Face refuses to lie for him and presses him to reveal info.
Smiles confidently when B.A. refuses to lie under pressure.
Stares silently and flushed when asked about his art history major, showing embarrassment or discomfort.
Is visibly stunned and realizes he has been outmaneuvered by Face.
Launches physically to protect Face despite being restrained, showing loyalty and willingness to fight for his teammate.
Gives Face a 'death stare' as he is pulled away, indicating anger and protective feelings toward his team member.
Maintains a silent, steadfast stare at Captain Lynch after his Special Forces pin is removed, showing resilience but no direct hostile behavior beyond firm resolve.
Launches aggressively to free Face despite being cuffed, fights MPs determinedly, keeps a defiant stare at Face signaling leadership and resolve.
Stares down Captain Lynch silently after being insulted and humiliated by having his Special Forces pin removed.
Reckless physical attack in a courtroom setting leading to arrest and conviction.
Stands easily and responds with calm, ironic humor to Captain Lynch’s strict rules.
Arranges books and magazines thoughtfully in his cell, suggesting a composed, respectful demeanor.
Maintains composure under hostile treatment by MPs, indicating resilience rather than coldness.
Squats to interact gently with feral cats, allowing a tabby to brush against his leg.
Politely asks for a cigar from Lynch despite being a prisoner.
Stays calm and observant while being provoked and mistreated by Lynch.
Maintains calm and humor despite imprisonment and attempts at psychological pressure from captors.
Attempts to negotiate or request a simple favor (asking for a cigar) but is denied, showing limited immediate influence.
Engages in physical exercise (jogging) to maintain condition even while captive, demonstrating discipline and preparation.
No apparent attempt to escape or resist under interrogation/strip privileges scenario in the excerpt.
Speaks kindly to and plays gently with a feral cat, scoops it up, scratches its belly till it purrs, strokes it again later.
Responds sarcastically and belligerently to Lynch's threats and attempts to break him, including insulting Lynch's mother.
Calmly sews a torn shirt in prison despite interrogation, showing focus and composure.
Mocks interrogator and refuses to break under pressure, indicating mental toughness and confidence.
Discovers and exploits a weakness in the cell wall by poking and chipping plaster, showing resourcefulness and planning.
Keeps up physical fitness routine in prison yard, staying prepared for action.
Engages in gentle interaction with a feral cat, demonstrating calmness and emotional control.
Carefully escapes prison using oatmeal and a hole in the wall without harming anyone.
Riskily retrieves mechanical parts and manages his escape thoughtfully, showing ingenuity rather than recklessness.
Uses oatmeal to conceal escape hole and wriggles through a hollow in the wall, climbs a ladder, and escapes via an exhaust vent despite the risk of falling.
Accidentally drops the galvanized exhaust pipe which causes a noise and reveals his escape route.
Silently escapes his cell by digging out of the mattress, showing resourcefulness and trust in his team by asking B.A. if he's ready to clear their names.
Shows no evident hostility or harshness even under pressure, working cooperatively with B.A. without confrontation.
Digs an escape tunnel by ripping through the mattress and escaping the cell undetected.
Successfully coordinates covert escape with B.A., displaying strategic teamwork.
Quickly assesses the situation with the HUMVEE and immediately asks B.A. to get it running despite no key present.
Looks at B.A. seriously and says, 'If you run with me, there’s no turning back.'
Encourages B.A. to keep driving despite danger: 'Do not stop.'
Encourages B.A. to keep going and not stop despite obstacles like the closing door and injury, showing calm decisiveness under pressure.
Uses a clever tactic by tying a strip of his shirt around a feral cat to track the pursuers' movements, demonstrating resourcefulness and strategic thinking.
Checks B.A.'s injured arm, insists on getting medical help despite B.A.'s reluctance.
Urgently seeks help from doctor, shows concern for teammate's well-being.
Checks E.A.'s stitches and assesses them with some concern.
Politely tells the nurse that Murdock will be back for his meds and thanks her.
Heaves Murdock back into the ambulance despite nurse's objections, taking donuts in a teasing manner.
Takes charge of an emergency situation, clearly instructs ground crew on safety protocol, and ensures their urgent evacuation to medical care.
Veers off the road to find a strategic location with a C-130 cargo plane and attempts to hijack it despite obstacles.
Commands ground crew out of the cargo plane area by bluffing an anthrax situation to clear the space efficiently.
Checks rearview mirror multiple times to monitor enemies’ positions, showing situational awareness.
Listens seriously to Murdock's claim, trusts his skill without needing to know personal background.
Acknowledges B.A.'s concerns with understanding and a bit of humor.
Plunges a sedative needle into B.A.'s arm to calm him down, showing care for his teammate's state.
Commands the pilot firmly but without hostility, coordinating escape without panic.
Encourages Murdock after a risky maneuver with a positive comment: 'Outstanding.'
Calmly directs the pilot to seek shelter in storm clouds despite danger, showing trust in his team’s capability.
Directs the pilot to make for storm clouds despite electrical danger, showing confident judgment in a risky tactical decision.
Maintains calm and clear command under missile attack, quickly adapting to the crisis.
Instructs Murdock calmly to stay in the cloud cover during a dangerous situation.
Questions Murdock to assess the problem with the Blackhawk helicopter, showing situational awareness.
Remains composed and guides an inexperienced pilot (Murdock) to control a helicopter under extreme duress.
Greets B.A. warmly with a friendly 'Good morning, sergeant' and helps him out of the chopper.
Greets B.A. with calm confidence upon landing the chopper, displaying leadership and control.
Allows B.A. to see Murdock flying the chopper, whose grin suggests a non-standard or risky approach, implying trust in his team and situation control.
Helps B.A. out of the chopper, reassuring him by noting his feet are on solid ground again.
Playfully punches Face in the side and gut upon surprise reunion.
Takes Face's gun during surprise encounter but does not threaten beyond control.
Greets Face with friendly teasing and physicality.
Intervenes to stop B.A. from hitting Face, showing restraint and control.
Leans in close to Face in a non-hostile manner before proceeding, indicating calm and controlled confidence.
Approaches a dangerous criminal (Agostelli) calmly and engages in negotiation rather than violence.
Puffs cigar confidently in a threatening situation, exuding tough demeanor but not hostile aggression.
Diffuses a violent situation by commanding B.A. to stop and calmly interrogates Face about the engine and connections, demonstrating situational control and strategic questioning.
Confronts a known crime syndicate leader (Agostelli) directly with confidence while armed men point guns at him, showing high confidence, composure, and negotiation skill under pressure.
Uses knowledge of criminal networks (Comorra) and their activities (fencing art) to leverage a negotiation, indicating intelligence and resourcefulness.
Uses intimidation and threats while negotiating with Agostelli, showing willingness to cause harm to get what he wants.
Commands B.A. to harm Antonio to pressure Agostelli but stops when Agostelli gives in, showing controlled aggression.
Uses calm intimidation and clever tactics to coerce Agostelli into giving up the name of the fence by playing on his fears and leveraging his brother's safety.
Coordinates with team members (B.A. and Murdock) effectively to create a high-pressure situation involving a rigged jet engine to manipulate the opponent.
Asks Murdock a practical, specific question about shoe size to aid in their ruse, demonstrating foresight and attention to detail.
Maintains composure and control even when Agostelli threatens Face, effectively managing interpersonal dynamics and threats.
Threatens Agostelli with severe consequences if he talks, using intimidation and a harsh tone.
Gives orders calmly and looks out for his team’s safety, telling Agostelli they will call his brother once safely away.
Dismissively comments on Peck ‘doing what he does best - saving his own skin’, showing skepticism or lack of trust.
Watches Face being choked by B.A., semi-amused but ultimately lets Face join despite earlier hostility.
Tells B.A. to kill Face immediately without hesitation.
Allows Face to join despite initial mistrust, showing confidence in Face's value and judgment.
Watches the confrontation between B.A. and Face with amusement, maintaining control of the situation.
Does not intervene physically or escalate the conflict, trusting his team dynamics and negotiation skills.
Carefully observes the target area using binoculars, counts crewmen, and assesses their security detail.
Communicates clearly and efficiently with General Garner, acknowledging possible betrayals.
Plans a detailed, cautious operation with the team, giving clear instructions and emphasizing timing and stealth.
Stops B.A. and Face's confrontation with a calm, moderating command to focus on their mission, preventing conflict among team members.
Teases Face about the Rolex being a knock-off, showing a light-hearted, friendly interaction.
Gives Face careful, considerate last-minute instructions to avoid trouble during the auction, demonstrating concern for his teammate's success and safety.
Pulls Face away from the blonde pickpocket, prioritizing mission safety over socializing.
Uses humor to warn about Grushko’s wife and advises caution.
Dismisses social interaction to focus on mission.
Warns Face about the danger of the party and calls it a mission, not a social event, showing awareness and caution.
Pulls Face away from the manipulative blonde who is pickpocketing him, demonstrating quick perception and intervention.
Keeps an eye out for Grushko and signals the location of the gold vase, showing situational awareness and planning.
Maintains composure despite setbacks and insistence on sticking with the plan, coordinating team movement calmly.
Expresses frustration by saying 'shit' when plan encounters difficulty.
Leans close to Face, showing attentive and engaged behavior.
No direct warm interactions observed; mainly observes and studies vase silently.
Leans close to Face, studying the golden vase during a high-stakes art auction, showing careful attention and involvement in the situation.
Softly states he needs to see if Al-Mahdi is on board before proceeding.
Tries the locked door and forces it open to continue the mission.
Maintains focus on the monitor and carefully observes Al-Mahdi’s situation.
Engages in close-in fighting to disarm attacking guard and ensures to lock the door behind him for safety.
Focuses on tactical advantage and quick escape without hesitation or unnecessary violence beyond neutralizing threat.
Quickly disarms a security guard who reached for a gun, then uses a laptop as a weapon to neutralize the threat, and promptly locks the door behind him while escaping.
Appears confidently alongside Face at a critical moment during a high-stakes auction and commands to buy the item, showing situational awareness and control.
Acts like Face’s assistant to support his cover during the auction.
Throws the vase to prevent it from being taken, causing a scene but protecting the team.
Acts like Face’s assistant to support the con, showing adaptability and strategic thinking.
Throws the vase to explode it before guards can react, indicating quick decision-making and control over the situation.
Leaps onto the strut and pulls Face inside the Flying Boat to safety.
Extends his hand to frozen B.A., encouraging him to get on the plane.
Physically saves B.A.'s life by pulling him fully inside the plane despite apparent risk.
Jokes about saving B.A.'s life even when B.A. is annoyed.
Shows a fierce, determined look ('murder in his eyes') while saving B.A., reflecting intensity but no direct warmth indicator.
Acknowledges the presence and importance of his team despite their quirks (B.A. with eyes shut, Murdock swatting at imaginary bugs) and confidently states 'I definitely have a team.'
Decides to go on a dangerous mission alone after identifying the connection to Green Lake insignias and the museum artifacts.
Notices a tiny 'GLS' insignia on a sleeve that others missed, deducing a key detail about Al-Mahdi's identity and location.
Decides to go alone into a 'well-funded, well-protected death trap' to find Al-Mahdi and recover museum artifacts despite the dangers mentioned by Gen. Garner.
Acknowledge that his team is less than perfect (with B.A. closing his eyes and Murdock swatting at imaginary bugs) but still confidently asserts he 'definitely has a team.'
Smiles and talks about showing the world they actually care about the people they are liberating.
Uses his reputation and influence to ensure Pentagon and Congress support, securing political backing for their missions.
Walks away from a subordinate who wants to discuss direction, showing decisiveness but possibly shutting down dialogue.
Smiles while casually discussing the plan with the team in McDonald's, showing relaxed camaraderie.
Tries to stop Elizabeth from hanging up, indicating he values the connection and perhaps cares about her feelings.
Gets taken aback and frozen by Elizabeth's voice, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Carefully analyzes the high-security office layout and identifies key security measures, considering guard routines and secure communications, demonstrating detailed planning.
Engages the team in tactical discussion, querying B.A. about infiltration timing and distance, showing thorough understanding of operational constraints.
Responds to Face's skepticism with calm confidence and humor, indicating self-assuredness in the plan despite apparent risks.
Is momentarily frozen and caught off guard by Elizabeth's unexpected phone call, showing a brief lapse in situational control.
Acknowledges Elizabeth's new life and family with a somewhat genuine but awkward attempt to connect.
Asks for a favor without showing genuine concern for Elizabeth's feelings or circumstances.
Expresses happiness for Elizabeth's life despite their past strained relationship.
Pushes Elizabeth to help him even after she indicates he does not care about her well-being.
Attempts to reconnect with Elizabeth and asks for a favor despite awkwardness, showing persistence and social awareness.
Uses a poor transition when changing the subject, indicating some social awkwardness or lack of finesse.
Shows emotional intelligence by acknowledging Elizabeth's life changes and expressing happiness for her.
Pushes for assistance without showing genuine concern for Elizabeth’s feelings, which causes distrust.
Reassures B.A. about Murdock's bravery, shows understanding of others' feelings.
Casually accepts being photographed by a security camera without panic.
Encourages his team by telling them to give Murdock a chance despite the tense situation.
Remains calm and confident despite being identified and potentially compromised in the tower, telling Pike to 'give him a chance' indicating trust in his plan and team.
Appears in a situation where team members (Murdock, B.A., Face) are nervous and uncertain; Hannibal's calm presence suggests competence through leadership and control under pressure.
Listens in on a critical situation discreetly without interfering directly.
Does not intervene as Daniels makes an aggressive approach to Murdock, instead observing the dynamics to gather intelligence.
Acts befuddled and compliant when caught, defusing tension.
Uses a secret disc to aid escape while appearing cooperative.
Others express concern about his movements and plans, implying he is a key figure to track for smuggling stolen goods, indicating he operates with skill in high-stakes situations.
No direct action or dialogue from Hannibal in this excerpt; however, the fact that other characters strategize around him suggests an intelligent and confident operator.
Engages in a friendly guessing game about the guard's origin, correctly identifies details, making the guard smile.
Violently headbutts and kicks the Okie guard unconscious without warning.
Offers to come to Face when he is nearby and possibly in trouble.
Punches Lynch in the ribs playfully and disarms him.
Strips off ear piece and wire, locks his wrists inside/out of the steering wheel to avoid suspicion.
Defends his team against unjust accusations and insists on proving innocence, expressing belief in fairness and justice.
Confidently confronts Lynch and retrieves his Special Forces pin, showing loyalty to his team and their honor.
Throws open van door and helps team get in to escape danger.
Gently restrains Sosa from pulling her gun to prevent harm.
Sits beside Sosa and offers her a choice, showing willingness to negotiate and avoid conflict.
Makes a promise to prove their innocence within 24 hours and turn themselves in if they fail, demonstrating sincerity and trustworthiness.
Pressures Sosa to cooperate but allows her the dignity of choice.
Takes control of the situation by throwing open the van door and organizing the team's escape under fire.
Calmly defuses a potentially violent moment by physically restraining Sosa from using her gun, despite the car swerving.
Confidently negotiates with Sosa, presenting a logical choice and appealing to reason to persuade her to consider helping them.
Demonstrates situational awareness by referencing intelligence from Lynch about Green Lake and using this info as leverage in his argument.
Misses an opportunity to fully secure Sosa's cooperation when the team members immediately reject turning themselves in, slightly undermining his offer.
Includes Sosa and the whole team in the plan, showing trust and inclusiveness.
Motivates the team with a confident and encouraging statement before the mission.
Focuses on the mission outcome and the stakes without emotional display or personal warmth.
Clearly leads the team with a confident plan involving all members and sets a motivating tone before the mission.
Acknowledges the stakes realistically, emphasizing the limited timeframe to complete the mission successfully.
Orders Sosa not to check the road, asserting command firmly.
Immediately aims rifle at the guard when Sosa is grabbed, protecting her.
Lowers rifle after threat is neutralized and calmly directs team to move on without visible anger.
Observes tire tracks and deduces the size of the vehicle, shows situational awareness.
Orders Sosa not to investigate further but is caught off guard when she disobeys and gets captured.
Responds immediately by aiming his rifle at the guard, displaying readiness and control.
Low risk reaction by lowering the rifle and quickly deciding to move on after incident.
Shares a poetic allusion about a sick boy and a magical mountain wall while studying the environment, indicating thoughtfulness and a subtle attempt to connect meaningfully.
Keeps focused on tactical details and cautiously optimistic tone ('Well, we either caught a lucky break, Or... We found it.') showing steady leadership without brusqueness.
Carefully scopes out the area, assesses situation thoughtfully and cautiously.
Considers multiple possibilities (either lucky break or found correct location) showing situational awareness.
Studies the wall by touch and recalls a related poem to metaphorically understand the situation, demonstrating analytical thinking.
Shows concern by acknowledging the explosion was heavier than expected and is visibly worried.
Shakes his head and rocks on his feet, indicating frustration or sympathy that the target moved.
Calmly assesses situation and uses a lever to reveal hidden underground garage, demonstrating steady leadership without panic.
Commands Dr. Al-Mahdi to turn his head, showing a mix of authority but also a considerate acknowledgment of Al-Mahdi’s discomfort.
Identifies the use of hydraulics to reveal the hidden underground garage by pulling a large lever to lower the floor, demonstrating quick thinking and situational awareness under pressure.
Shows visible worry and uncertainty (rocking on his feet) after the explosion and discovering the empty space, indicating momentary doubt or concern.
Uses an iron rod resourcefully to pop the chain from his foot.
Nods and cooperates silently with Face's decision to watch the flank.
Quickly texts coordinates and organizes sending a Ranger platoon to assist.
Communicates efficiently and shares information with his team (B.A.), showing trust.
Stays hidden, flat on his stomach in the underground garage during a dangerous enemy sweep, maintaining stealth and avoiding detection.
Keeps Al-Mahdi's head low to protect him during heavy gunfire.
Snaps off the rear view mirror and uses it to reflect off the side mirror to navigate while under fire.
Keeps Al-Mahdi's head low as bullets cut through the trailer and ammo explodes nearby, demonstrating calm under fire and care for others while managing risk.
Leaps from the trailer and immediately takes control in the cab, coordinating with B.A. to evade pursuers across rough terrain and successfully advises B.A. to kill the lights to avoid detection.
Reassures B.A. by expressing confidence in the safety of the priceless art cargo under attack.
Does not respond when B.A. tries to get his attention in a moment of danger.
Leaps from the cliff and attacks the enemy pilot to protect his team.
Charges Pike after crash and disarms him non-lethally before a deadly move.
Engages in close combat, recovers from being thrown and disorients opponent with a concealed special forces pin, ultimately killing Pike to survive.
Involved in a helicopter crash after the Blackhawk clips a rock and flips over.
Explains the reasoning behind his secretive actions to Face and Sosa, showing trust and inclusiveness.
Walks over to B.A., eyes soft, looks him in the eye, indicating a sincere and warm connection.
Coordinates a complex plan involving multiple team members and resources to clear their names and evade pursuers.
Exudes confidence by expressing satisfaction when the plan comes together.
Keeps important information from team member B.A., which could potentially undermine team cohesion.
Walks over to B.A. with soft eyes and looks him in the eye before apologizing for doubting him.
Promises to defend B.A. vigorously if anyone doubts him again, salutes him which B.A. returns.
Negotiates thoughtfully with Dr. Al-Mahdi, showing respect and consideration for the cultural and ethical implications of their mission.
Shows hesitation and discomfort when confronted with the difficulty of the situation (shifts on his feet).
Acknowledges Elizabeth's help and says 'I owe you,' showing appreciation despite a curt ending.
Smiles appreciatively after being chagrined by Elizabeth's rejection.
Contemplates and hesitates before taking a phone call, indicating respect or caution.
Realizes a key inconsistency and continues to think critically about the case.
Initiates a phone call to Elizabeth and skillfully obtains critical information about a bank laundering money.
Responds to Elizabeth's curt dismissal with an appreciative smile, showing emotional intelligence and confidence.
Physically assaults General Garner repeatedly during confrontation.
Walks away from the fallen General Garner without offering help after suicide.
Calmly comments on his own skill after knocking out Garner, showing some candidness but detached.
Shakes head in disappointment at General Garner's suicide, indicating some emotional reaction.
Confronts General Garner confidently, physically subdues him twice, and escapes the situation efficiently before authorities arrive.
Shows quick situational awareness by turning back immediately after hearing a gunshot and assessing the scene of Garner's suicide.
Avoids direct confrontation with military police by leaving the scene promptly, demonstrating prudent risk management.
Uses self-deprecating humor about being better with his right hand after knocking Garner out, indicating confidence and composure under pressure.
Fails to prevent General Garner's suicide despite being present at the moment, reflecting a limit to control over outcomes.
Smiles and gives practical advice to his team despite their dire situation.
Appears hesitant and unsure when confronted by the middle-aged woman seeking help.
Politely but firmly declines to help the woman, showing reluctance to engage.
Recognizes the team's wanted status and the difficulty of proving innocence, calmly instructs the team to change their appearance and watch their backs.
Smiles reassuringly when advising about caution and disguise, demonstrating confidence in a difficult situation.
Hesitates and says he doesn’t know what he can do when approached by a desperate woman seeking help.
Expresses sympathy to Sosa by saying 'I'm sorry' about being a scapegoat.
Poses a direct question to the woman to understand her needs ('How’d you find me, ma’am?').
Checks willingness of soldiers with 'You soldiers want to do this?' showing leadership but neutral in warmth.
